alert.note: Alert for Hampden; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:19PM EST until December 20 at 7:40PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Middle Haddam, Northampton, Hartford, Thompsonville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Northampton. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding affects a large portion of the Oxbow in Northampton. Flood waters also reach Route 5, a portion of which may be impassable. Flooding spreads across the lower lying sections of Hadley. In Hatfield, back water from the Connecticut River will push the Mill River over its banks, flooding parts of Valley Street and surrounding areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 111.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 112.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 115.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 112.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 115.0 feet on 05/01/1956. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at noon EST.
